string-array.name: game_rules_array
string-array.item: Goal: Move all cards, organized by suit and in ascending order from Ace to King, to the final deck area consisting of 4 empty foundation piles.
You can build sequences within the columns on the table by placing cards in descending order (e.g. 6-5-4...) but only if they are of the same suit.
To win, each of the 4 foundation piles must start with an Ace and be built up in the same suit through to the King (Ace, 2, 3... King).
You may move entire suited sequences or individual cards between columns to create empty spaces and reveal new cards.
Only an Ace or a sequence starting with an Ace can be placed into an empty foundation pile (final deck space).
You do not have a personal hand; use only the cards available on the table and in the 4 sub-decks (if present) to progress.
You win the game by successfully building all 4 suits from Ace to King in the foundation piles.
You lose if there are no legal moves left and not all cards have been moved to the final deck.

Note: This game uses Piacentine cards. Each suit (Coins, Cups, Swords, Clubs) has 10 cards: Ace (1), 2â€“7, Knave (Fante), Knight (Cavallo), and King (Re). The order is Ace to King. Learn to recognize the suits and court cards before playing.
